title: E field - comparing fields after charge moved

content.question: Two small spheres have charges <math alttext="negative Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> and <math alttext="positive Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math>, as shown in the figure. In their initial configuration the positive sphere is a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> to the right of the negative sphere. The electric field at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, which is located a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> to the right of the positive sphere, initially has a magnitude of <math alttext="E sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math>. The negative sphere is then moved to a location a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> to the right of Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>. In this final configuration, the electric field at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> has a magnitude of <math alttext="E sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>. What is the ratio <math alttext="the fraction E sub f over E sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mfrac></math>?
